Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Short Stay”
Reviews.Author: Richard C
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel for a short stay in Barcelona, excellently long breakfast times, extra late at the weekend. Metro just around the corner so any part of the city is very accessible (Barcelona card helped, as did all the discounts). Very welcoming staff, great selection for breakfasts, good quality clean rooms, only fault was it was a twin bed and not a double. Hotel Mandanis is not just for football.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel next to Camp Nou”
Reviews.Author: Peter103
Reviews.Content: I would like to say thank you very much! In this hotel everybody are very helpful and kindly. The servise was very good! If you like FC Barcelona and you want to go to the match, your best choose if you stay at Hotel Madanis! The prices are corrects.The dishes are very fine. Peter from Hungary

Reviews.Title: “FCB Barcelona Trip”
Reviews.Author: Philip H
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my 11 year old son to watch a match at the Camp Nou on Saturday 3rd March. We found this hotel offered a brilliant location only two minutes walk from the nearest McDonald's and also the Metro station, the main train station is 10 mins by metro. It was within 5 mins walk from the grounds of the Camp Nou. For location there is no better. The hotel itself was very clean and it had a welcome feeling from the staff on duty, they spoke English and offered help and advice. The rooms provide an adequate accommodation and the beds were very comfortable again the room was very clean. The hotel offers free WiFi connection which was great for my son to keep in touch with his mum. The only slightly negative point I could find is the fall points could do with some sound insulation. I will defiantly stay again in this hotel and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel next to Camp Nou”
Reviews.Author: Burak D
Reviews.Content: I went to Barcelona to see a game of the football club. Therefore,i chose to stay in Madanis. The room was perfect,extremely clean, and definitely comfortable.Highly recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from 13/1/12-17/1/12. I visited Barcelona mainly to watch the football match versus Real Betis at the Nou Camp. The hotel is located very conveniently next to the stadium. With the metro station nearby, access to the rest of the city is quick & easy (I managed to visit many locations). I found the hotel excellent in all aspects. The staff were both friendly & informative, nothing was too much trouble. The room was very clean, with high quality decor & amenities. (That also goes for the rest of the hotel). When I booked the break I opted to have the breakfast each day, I was so pleased I did. The food was of a very high standard & the staff were attentive. The hotel provided very good value for money. It definitely warrants its 4 star status. If ever I visit the city again, I will be selecting this hotel. Mark Hackett. (England)

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: SuperOFW
Reviews.Content: 1 minute walk from the Metro. Clean rooms, friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location for the football”
Reviews.Author: F_H_1186411
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend with the family to watch Barcelona win Levante 5-0, Hotel is in perfect location for a visit to the Camp Nou for a match or the museum. Hotel Madanis took delivery of our match tickets for us and everything went smoothly from start to finish of our break. The hotel was clean and comfortable for our needs. It is conveniently placed with bars and shops/supermarkets close by and good transport links. The hotel staff were friendly & we would certainly recommend and visit this hotel again ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly placed to watch barcelona fc.”
Reviews.Author: flan44
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend in Barcelona watching the football. Barcelona v zaragosa. Wanted to stay near camp nou and chose Hotel Madanis. Good choice, rooms clean and comfy, breakfast very good and close to Metro for visits to the city. Flew with Monarch, good but early, picked up football tickets easily, and 5 minutes walk to hotel. The only drawback with hotel was, you could hear some road noise and the lifts, but we were vey tired each day so it was not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “More Than You Payed For”
Reviews.Author: Pedro_Miguel_Neto
Reviews.Content: Been in Barcelona for a week, and stayed in this little shining pearl of a Hotel. Breakfast was superb, rooms were small but clean and confortable, and the whole building smelled like brand new. And it was! Really loved the windowed reception, also. Service was very thoughtful, and the price is less than you think it is. Highly recommended if you want to go on a family trip or check out a FC Barcelona game. It's only half a mile of Camp Nou, maybe less.

Reviews.Title: “'ok' Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tiago-SP
Reviews.Content: Overall: This is a good hotel. It's clean, the room is small but not too tiny (like same others in Europe) and the employers are very gentil and helpful. Localization: This Hotel is not "central" but is very near of a subway station, So you can reach any part of Barcelona very quickly. It is a just a walk distant from Barcelona FC Stadium (so, if you will stay to see a soccer game, this is the Hotel). Price: The price is very good... So, if you want to spend a couple of days in Barcelona and spend less than 90 euros per day for a clean hotel. Madanis should be your choice. Issues: I had a problem with the Internet (that was free). It didn't work in my room. So, I needed to use in the main loby... I think the problem is structural... I stayed in the apartments that is in a different build of the main hotel. It is near, but not to get the wi-fi connection. They should fix this urgently or just say, that in the apartments you will not have wi-fi internet.

Reviews.Title: “Conference Trip at UPC”
Reviews.Author: dasanchez86
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superb clean. The staff is amazing, very good service. Great location near the Camp Nou and the Collblanc metro station. The Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya is close to the hotel (20 minutes). The rooms are really comfortable. WiFi everywhere in the rooms. Nice week there!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: TrolleySnatcha
Reviews.Content: Amazing service. Girls who served us spoke many languages and very friendly. Room was very spacious and good view of Camp Nou. Easy to get to Camp Nou for games and only 2 minutes away from nearest Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel and the staff were very very good”
Reviews.Author: PedroCalvario
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, the room very good, the bathroom very big and clean also. The staff is very nice We love it. the hotel is very near to a metro station - Collblanc. from there you can go anywhere. very very good

Reviews.Title: “No frills, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: BBreton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brand new and divided in 2 sections. The rooms are well appointed and being all new also means it's all very clean. The sleep quality is very good and the rooms are very quiet. The restaurant is unfortunately not in a great neighborhood and there is little to see/visit/eat around the hotel. That being said, the hotel is right by the Collblanc metro station and hence, it's very easy to go anywhere in Barcelona with the Metro. So if you are Ok with the idea of taking the metro anytime you go somewhere, then you will find this hotel just fine. The staff was generally quite helpful too and the prices seems reasonable (its was not for us given that this was during MWC but otherwise, I assume this hotel would be reasonably priced).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndreeaElena
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not in a central zone,but the subway is near and from there you can get to any part of the city. The Stadium is soo close.It is situated in a residential neighborhood,I felt safe walking throw it.A lot of shops near, but be careful they are all closed on Sunday. The hotel is nice, clean, great service,but it has a huge problem: you can hear all the noise from outside,like words and sentences!The windows are so thin,I don't know if it's a hotel problem,or a city one. The meal was great,even for my picky boyfriend. Overall the hotel is nice and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Small nice hotel but some problems with stay”
Reviews.Author: Biscas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fairly small (5 rooms per floor) and it is very clean and comfortable. However, three things are preventing me from giving it a classification of 4 or even 5. To start, we had a problem with our parking reserved parking space and had to wait close to two hours before having it resolved. The breakfast is of good quality but short on variety. The last problem had to do with "sleep quality", it rained all week and it seems that the outside dripping water from upper levels keeps pounding away at the room windows on ALL rooms ending with number 3 (ex. 203, 303, 403, 503, etc.). This was annoying and would either keep me awake or woke me up from time to time. Colleagues of mine in other floors had the same problem. Nonetheless, a good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Can't agree with previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: spursmanLondon
Reviews.Content: I have to say after spending the weekend in Barcelona and staying in the Madanis Hotel for two nights I couldn't recommend anyone to stay there. Although the room was clean and the staff were very nice and helpful, the negatives far out wayed this good points. The room I stayed in was on the first floor and it was very noisy, although some of the noise came from the outside (buses stopping outside window) most of the noise came from a soil pipe which went down behind a panel in the room. The breakfast also was very poor, certain ammount of the food on offer is put out and left for so long that the quality of it was awful by the time we had breakfast at around 9.00am. Eggs, sausages, bacon, hams etc were never replenished for fresher food during all the time we spent in breakfast area. No facilities in rooms to make tea / coffee. Had hassle getting a cup of tea for my wive at around 10pm due to main machine not working, water had to be warmed up by using mircowave. Made tea in cup, took it up to room myself, and still got charged for it. In England this hotel would not get the 4 stars it is supposed to have. You are paying purely for the decor of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good service.”
Reviews.Author: norwegiandanish
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here two years in a row. It has a nice location, if you don’t want to live downtown Barcelona. It is about 10-15 min. walking from Nou Camp, the metro station is 200 m. away, and it is the Collblanc station on line 5. Around the metro station it is several shops like Zara, Mango and Douglas, if you like to shop. It has also some supermarkets close by and also a local market that is open in the morning until about 3 pm. The hotel has a parking garage right over the street from the hotel. If you buy a parking space at the hotel it cost 21.5€ a night, and if you buy it at the parking it costs 24€ a night. If you are going to stay several nights it is best to not pay at the hotel, then you can get the deal to pay 80€ for up to 7 days. The parking is very small, so if you have a big car, it is almost impossible to go in with the car. Be careful! The reception is nice, and they are very friendly and helpful. They have also a small bar next to the reception, and also a laptop with Wi-Fi. It is free Wi-Fi in the apartments; don’t know if it is in the hotel also. We have rented one of the apartments they have. We have rented a 5 persons apartment, with 3 bedrooms, kitchen, living room and a bathroom. The bedrooms is a master bedroom with a/c and a double bed, a single bedroom with one bed, and a two persons room with either a double bed, two single beds or a bunk bed. The living room does also have a/c. You have also a washing machine, so you can wash your clothes if needed. If you don’t want to bother with making your own food, you can pay 7.5€ and get the breakfast at the hotel (have not tried it), and eat at some of the restaurants that is close by. The apartment is cleaned weekly. We are very glad for the opportunity to rent an apartment at a hotel, rather than a private person. It is more safe (got robbed in a private one our first time in Barcelona), and you have the cleaning once a week (better than nothing).

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: abc_def062
Reviews.Content: This is a very stylish hotel in a quiet street quite near to the Collblanc metro. The area of town is quite far from the centre and you need to take 2 metros to get there, but it is right beside the Camp Nou football stadium, so very convenient for matches. I stayed in a twin room for €120 per night, which to my mind was more money than I'd normally want to pay for Barcelona. The room was good quality with a decent ensuite bathroom but was quite small for a twin. The hotel doesn't have any particular good extras such as good restaurant or bar to make it worth the extra money. Also it's too far from the centre of Barcelona for me (I got a bit tired of the metro journey after a few days of taking it), and the area of town is a bit non-descript. Having said that, I had a very pleasant stay here; it's nice and quiet and the hotel staff were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_Crosbie
Reviews.Content: I visited Barcelona to see a concert with my girlfriend and two friends. All in all, the stay was most enjoyable. My girlfriend is quite picky about hotels being clean and modern, and she was thoroughly impressed with the Madanis. The staff were very friendly and quite knowledgable about the area. My room was very clean and comfortable and had a nice big shower. I've read another review about a broken air-conditioner. I think this *might* be because the windows MUST be closed to use the air-con, so I suggested to the staff that they make this more obvious. The hotel is right beside the Collblanc metro stop which goes directly to Sants and Diagonal via the L5, so it is very well connected to the rest of the city. My stay was more for relaxation than sight-seeing so I spent quite some time in the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Madanis Hotel
